title: MEZ Cross-Corridor Settlement Anchor
description:
Binds an obligation corridor checkpoint/receipt to a settlement corridor checkpoint/receipt, with optional externally-verifiable proof references. This is a core building block for cross-corridor settlement, netting, and corridor-to-corridor finality bridges.

Semantic digest is sha256(signing_input(anchor)) (i.e., sha256(JCS(anchor_without_proof))).

settlement_id.description: Optional operator correlation id (urn:uuid:..., urn:mez:settlement:..., etc.).

relationship.description: Optional relationship label (e.g., settles, nets, cancels, escrow-releases).

receipt_next_root.description: Optional receipt next_root digest for the obligation event.

head_commitment_digest_sha256.description: Optional corridor head commitment digest (non-normative; can be recomputed from receipts).

finality_status_ref.description: Optional ArtifactRef to a finality-status object for this corridor head.

receipt_next_root.description: Optional receipt next_root digest for the settlement confirmation event.

head_commitment_digest_sha256.description: Optional corridor head commitment digest (non-normative; can be recomputed from receipts).

finality_status_ref.description: Optional ArtifactRef to a finality-status object for this corridor head.

proof_bindings.description: Optional list of portable proof-binding artifacts that cryptographically bind external proofs to the corridor commitments in this anchor.

proofs.description: Optional raw proof artifact refs (blobs, VCs, PDFs, etc.) for convenience. Prefer proof_bindings when possible.

proof.description: Optional DataIntegrityProof (JCS + Ed25519) for the anchor object.
